transportAdvice: Santiago has an extensive metro system that covers most tourist areas and is the fastest way to get around. Buses complement the metro and are well-integrated, while taxis are widely available. The city center is walkable, especially around the historic core and Lastarria neighborhood.

weather.description: Peak summer with hot, dry days and clear skies; perfect for enjoying outdoor dining and nearby vineyards.
Still hot and dry with long summer days, ideal for day trips to the coast or Andes.
Late summer brings slightly cooler evenings while days remain warm and pleasant.
Autumn arrives with comfortable temperatures and the first occasional rains of the season.
Cool autumn weather with increasing cloud cover and rain; pack layers for chilly mornings.
The start of winter with cool, rainy days and occasional smog; warm clothing recommended.
Coldest month with the most rainfall; nearby ski resorts in the Andes open for the season.
Late winter with gradually warming conditions, though rain persists through the month.
Spring begins with warming temperatures and blooming parks; rain decreases noticeably.
Pleasant spring weather with clear skies and comfortable temperatures for outdoor exploration.
Warm late spring with long days and low rainfall, one of the best months to visit.
Hot early summer with dry conditions and clear mountain views on most days.
